page.title: 17Grampound Village
page.content: The ancient township of Grampound is situated on the A390 about 6 miles from St. Austell and 7 miles from Truro.It was mentioned in the "Doomesday Book" and it was one of those areas confiscated by William the Conqueror and given to his half brother. Today it is a non growth village. There has been little new development here for many years apart from a small development known as Bonython Drive built 9 years ago. Being a main road village there is constant fear concerning safety.Many radar traps are put in the village but this does not seem to deter the speeding that goes on. The school is one of the main reasons that the village continues to thrive- few people choose to live in a village that does not have a school
